sentence1: Since they were very sweet and fragrant, he hoped to get a good price for them.
sentence2: A bonze with a torn cap and tattered robe stepped up to his cart and asked for one.

sentence1: A bonze with a torn cap and tattered robe stepped up to his cart and asked for one.
sentence2: The farmer repulsed him, but the bonze did not go.

sentence1: The farmer repulsed him, but the bonze did not go.
sentence2: Then the farmer grew angry and began to call him names.

sentence1: Then the farmer grew angry and began to call him names.
sentence2: The bonze said: "You have pears by the hundred in your cart.

sentence1: The bonze said: "You have pears by the hundred in your cart.
sentence2: I only ask for one.

sentence1: I only ask for one.
sentence2: The bystanders told the farmer that he ought to give the bonze one of the smaller pears and let him go.

sentence1: The bystanders told the farmer that he ought to give the bonze one of the smaller pears and let him go.
sentence2: An artisan saw the whole affair from his shop, and since the noise annoyed him, he took some money, bought a pear and gave it to the bonze.

sentence1: An artisan saw the whole affair from his shop, and since the noise annoyed him, he took some money, bought a pear and gave it to the bonze.
sentence2: The bonze thanked him and said: "One like myself, who has given up the world, must not be miserly.

sentence1: The bonze thanked him and said: "One like myself, who has given up the world, must not be miserly.
sentence2: I have beautiful pears myself, and I invite you all to eat them with me."

sentence1: I have beautiful pears myself, and I invite you all to eat them with me."
sentence2: Then some one asked: "If you have pears then why do you not eat your own?"

sentence1: Then some one asked: "If you have pears then why do you not eat your own?"
sentence2: He answered: "I first must have a seed to plant."

sentence1: He answered: "I first must have a seed to plant."
sentence2: And with that he began to eat the pear with gusto.

sentence1: And with that he began to eat the pear with gusto.
sentence2: When he had finished, he held the pit in his hand, took his pick-ax from his shoulder;

sentence1: When he had finished, he held the pit in his hand, took his pick-ax from his shoulder;
sentence2: Into this he thrust the pit, and covered it with earth.

sentence1: Into this he thrust the pit, and covered it with earth.
sentence2: Then he asked the folk in the market place for water, with which to water it.

sentence1: Then he asked the folk in the market place for water, with which to water it.
sentence2: A pair of curiosity seekers brought him hot water from the hostelry in the street, and with it the bonze watered the pit.

sentence1: A pair of curiosity seekers brought him hot water from the hostelry in the street, and with it the bonze watered the pit.
sentence2: The bonze climbed into the tree and handed down the pears to the bystanders.

sentence1: The bonze climbed into the tree and handed down the pears to the bystanders.
sentence2: Then the bonze took his pick-ax and cut down the tree.

sentence1: Then the bonze took his pick-ax and cut down the tree.
sentence2: Then he took the tree on his shoulder and walked away at an easy gait.

sentence1: Then he took the tree on his shoulder and walked away at an easy gait.
sentence2: When the bonze had begun to make his magic, the farmer, too, had mingled with the crowd.

sentence1: When the bonze had begun to make his magic, the farmer, too, had mingled with the crowd.
sentence2: With neck outstretched and staring eyes he had stood there and had entirely forgotten the business he hoped to do with his pears.

sentence1: With neck outstretched and staring eyes he had stood there and had entirely forgotten the business he hoped to do with his pears.
sentence2: His pears had all disappeared.

sentence1: His pears had all disappeared.
sentence2: Then he realized that the pears the bonze had divided had been his own.

sentence1: Then he realized that the pears the bonze had divided had been his own.
sentence2: He looked more closely, and the axle of his cart had disappeared.

sentence1: He looked more closely, and the axle of his cart had disappeared.
sentence2: The farmer fell into a rage and hastened after the bonze as fast as ever he could.

sentence1: The farmer fell into a rage and hastened after the bonze as fast as ever he could.
sentence2: And when he turned the corner, there lay the missing piece from the axle by the city wall.

sentence1: And when he turned the corner, there lay the missing piece from the axle by the city wall.
sentence2: And then he realized that the pear-tree which the bonze had chopped down must have been his axle.

sentence1: And then he realized that the pear-tree which the bonze had chopped down must have been his axle.
sentence2: The bonze, however, was nowhere to be found.
